column1: It would be preferable to relieve both supervisors and community banks from examining compliance with these kinds of requirements in order to concentrate resources on the real issues presently faced by these insti tutions, such as cybersecurity and interest rate risks.

Conclusion   Having  just become chair of the Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council, I hope to make the required decennial review under the Economic Growth and Regulatory Paperwork Re duction Act  (EGRPRA) a productive one.
